labelById.347043: 2: The Influence of Language and Culture on Identity
labelById.347045: 4: How Science and Technology Affect Our Lives
labelById.347046: 5: Factors That Impact the Quality of Life
labelById.346879: Skill Category 1: Comprehend written, audio, audiovisual, and visual text (text and pictures).
labelById.346880: Skill 1.A: Describe the literal meaning of the text.
labelById.346884: Skill Category 2: Make cultural and interdisciplinary connections.
labelById.346885: Skill 2.A: Make connections among cultural and interdisciplinary information provided in texts.
labelById.346886: 2.A.1: Determine or infer the meaning of a text using provided cultural and/or interdisciplinary information.
labelById.346887: 2.A.2: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to the target culture or interdisciplinary phenomena.
labelById.346888: 2.A.3: Describe content and connections among cultural and interdisciplinary topics.
labelById.346889: Skill Category 3: Interpret the content of written or audio text (words).
labelById.346890: Skill 3.A: Interpret the distinguishing features of a text.
labelById.346893: 3.A.3: Identify and/or describe the point(s) of view, perspective(s), tone, or attitude.
labelById.346894: Skill 3.B: Interpret the meaning of a text.
labelById.346897: Skill Category 4: Make meanings from words and expressions.
labelById.346898: Skill 4.A: Determine the meaning of familiar and unfamiliar words.
labelById.346899: 4.A.1: Determine the meaning of a variety of vocabulary.
labelById.346901: Skill 4.B: Use words appropriate for a given context.
labelById.346902: 4.B.1: Use a variety of vocabulary in written and spoken communication.
labelById.346903: 4.B.2: Explain or use idiomatic and culturally authentic expressions.
labelById.346904: Skill Category 5: Communicate interpersonally by speaking with others.
labelById.346905: Skill 5.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.346906: 5.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close spoken exchanges.
labelById.346907: 5.A.2: Comprehend an interlocutor's message in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346908: 5.A.3: Provide and obtain relevant information in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346909: 5.A.4: Use appropriate register and greeting for the intended target culture audience in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346910: 5.A.5: Use pronunciation and tones that are comprehensible when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346911: 5.A.6: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346912: 5.A.7: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, asking for repetition, and paraphrasing to maintain spoken exchanges.
labelById.346913: Skill 5.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.346914: 5.B.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346915: 5.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346916: 5.B.3: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346917: 5.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken exchanges.
labelById.346918: Skill Category 6: Communicate interpersonally by writing to others.
labelById.346919: Skill 6.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal writing.
labelById.346920: 6.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close written exchanges.
labelById.346921: 6.A.2: Provide and obtain relevant information in written exchanges.
labelById.346922: 6.A.3: Provide suggestions, ideas, and/or opinions with supporting details and/or examples in written exchanges.
labelById.346923: 6.A.4: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written exchanges.
labelById.346924: 6.A.5: Use register appropriate for the intended target culture audience in written exchanges.
labelById.346925: 6.A.6: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, and paraphrasing to maintain written exchanges.
labelById.346926: Skill 6.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal writing.
labelById.346927: 6.B.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in written exchanges.
labelById.346928: 6.B.2: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written exchanges.
labelById.346929: 6.B.3: Use standard conventions of written language (e.g., orthography, punctuation) in written exchanges.
labelById.346930: 6.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written exchanges.
labelById.346931: Skill 6.C: Understand and apply appropriate writing systems in interpersonal writing.
labelById.346932: 6.C.1: Use selected writing system (simplified OR traditional characters) consistently in written exchanges.
labelById.346933: 6.C.2: Use handwriting to communicate in written exchanges.
labelById.346934: 6.C.3: Use keyboarding to communicate in written exchanges.
labelById.346935: Skill Category 7: Communicate through spoken presentations.
labelById.346936: Skill 7.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational speaking.
labelById.346937: 7.A.1: Use a process to plan spoken presentations.
labelById.346938: 7.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in spoken presentations.
labelById.346939: Skill 7.B: Use appropriate vocal and visual strategies to communicate an idea for presentational speaking.
labelById.346940: 7.B.1: Produce spoken presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and conclusion.
labelById.346941: 7.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in spoken presentations.
labelById.346942: 7.B.3: Use pronunciation and tones in spoken presentations that are comprehensible to speakers of the target language.
labelById.346943: 7.B.4: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery in spoken presentations.
labelById.346944: 7.B.5: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain spoken presentations.
labelById.346945: Skill 7.C: Use appropriate language and vocabulary for your audience for presentational speaking.
labelById.346946: 7.C.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken presentations.
labelById.346947: 7.C.2: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken presentations.
labelById.346948: 7.C.3: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken presentations.
labelById.346949: Skill 7.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea in presentational speaking.
labelById.346950: 7.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in spoken presentations.
labelById.346951: 7.D.2: Identify and describe features (including products, practices, and perspectives), of target cultural communities in spoken presentations.
labelById.346952: Skill Category 8: Communicate through written presentations.
labelById.346953: Skill 8.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational writing.
labelById.346954: 8.A.1: Use a process to plan written presentations.
labelById.346955: 8.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in written presentations.
labelById.346956: Skill 8.B: Use appropriate writing strategies to communicate an idea in presentational writing.
labelById.346957: 8.B.1: Produce written presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and conclusion.
labelById.346958: 8.B.2: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain written presentations.
labelById.346959: 8.B.3: Narrate stories based on visuals with a clear progression of ideas, including a beginning, a middle, and an end.
labelById.346960: Skill 8.C: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in presentational writing.
labelById.346961: 8.C.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in written presentations.
labelById.346962: 8.C.2: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written presentations.
labelById.346963: 8.C.3: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written presentations.
labelById.346964: 8.C.4: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., orthography, punctuation) in written presentations.
labelById.346965: 8.C.5: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written presentations.
labelById.346966: Skill 8.D: Understand and apply appropriate writing systems in presentational writing.
labelById.346967: 8.D.1: Use selected writing system (simplified OR traditional characters) consistently in written presentations.
labelById.346968: 8.D.2: Use handwriting to communicate in written presentations.
labelById.346969: 8.D.3: Use keyboarding to communicate in written presentations.
